medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain, jaundice, dark red urine.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports that on an unspecified date he became 'backed' up and has been passing several bouts of first firm and then diarrhea stools. He has endorsed one bout of emesis on the night prior to admission. Abdominal pain has been present for several days, worse in the RUQ. Wife noticed jaundice upon her return after 2 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hodgkin's lymphoma, hypothyroidism, nephrolithiasis; prior surgeries include open splenectomy, right colectomy for polyps, total abdominal colectomy with ileosigmoid anastomosis for additional polyps.
medical_history.family_history: Mother alive with diabetes mellitus, father deceased from myocardial infarction at an unspecified age, also had diabetes mellitus.
